items.title: A Revolution Sparks From Beyond the Grave in Tlotlo Tsamaase's Dystopian Womb City
items.description: Womb City, the debut novel from acclaimed short fiction writer Tlotlo Tsamaase, is described as \u201cThe Handmaid\u2019s Tale meets Get Out\u201d and a \u201ccyberpunk body-hopping Africanfuturist ghost story.\u201d In other words, this is not your typical dystopian mystery, and io9 is thrilled to share a first look.Read more...

items.title: These School A/V Carts Have Killed at Least Three Kids and Are Being Recalled
items.description: The only thing more attractive to 5th graders than snow days are the days when the teacher wheels an A/V cart into the classroom. Even educational videos are a welcome reprieve from a teacher lecturing at the whiteboard, but according to the Consumer Product Safety Commission, a new recall means there\u2019s now reason to\u2026Read more...

items.title: Kids on BeReal Are Exposed to Sexual Content More Often Than Other Social Networks, Survey Finds
items.description: BeReal, a popular new spontaneous image-sharing app designed to show life, \u201cwithout filters,\u201d had the highest proportion of child users exposed to sexual content of any major social media app, according to a new survey shared with Gizmodo. Larger apps like YouTube and TikTok had more overall incidents of exposure to\u2026Read more...

items.title: Insider's Editor-in-Chief Announces Writers Will Begin Experimenting With AI
items.description: Insider\u2019s global editor-in-chief Nicholas Carlson has announced to both the newsroom and the public that the outlet will begin experimenting with ways to leverage ChatGPT for journalism.Read more...

items.title: Lower Decks Is Coming to the Star Trek RPG for Maximum Tabletop Shenanigans
items.description: Lower Decks as a Star Trek show already has the huge vibes of playing a tabletop roleplaying campaign in a world far more serious than the main players. So it makes perfect sense, at long last, for Modiphus\u2019 excellent Star Trek Adventures RPG to get on the fun in an official capacity.Read more...

items.title: Donated Blood Is Safe No Matter a Person's Sex, Large Trial Finds
items.description: A large new randomized clinical trial should put people who are ever in need of a blood transfusion more at ease. Scientists in Canada have found that the sex of a blood donor had no significant effect on the recipient\u2019s chances of survival. Several past studies had suggested a possible risk, but this appears to be\u2026Read more...

items.title: Italy Says ChatGPT Must Allow Users to Correct Inaccurate Personal Information
items.description: Italy, the first country in the world to ban ChatGPT, said OpenAI could restore access to the chatbot if it adopts a series of measures to protect data privacy, including allowing users to correct or delete the incorrect things ChatGPT says about them.Read more...

items.title: What to Expect When SpaceX's Starship Megarocket Attempts Its First Orbital Flight Next Week
items.description: The time is quickly nearing for SpaceX to perform the first fully integrated orbital flight test of Starship. Here\u2019s how the historic launch will unfold and what you can expect from Elon Musk\u2019s revolutionary megarocket.Read more...

items.title: How Wedge Antilles Ended Up in Star Wars: Visions Volume 2
items.description: When animation studios are asked to be a part of Star Wars: Visions, they have free rein to tell any story they want, as long as it\u2019s set in a galaxy far, far away. To a point. While it\u2019s not against the rules to make films with established characters, that\u2019s not the intention of the series.Read more...

items.title: This Square-Wheeled Bicycle Works Like a Pedal-Powered Tank

items.description: Using machine learning, a team of researchers has enhanced the first image ever taken of a distant black hole. Importantly, the newly updated image shows the full resolution of the telescope array for the very first time.Read more...

items.title: The EPA Is Being Sued for Approving Cancer-Causing Plastic-Based Fuels
items.description: We need climate action. In an alarming example, production of certain alternative \u201cclimate-friendly\u201d fuels could lead to dangerous, cancer-causing\u2026Read more...

items.title: Deep Space Missions Must Recreate Exact Earth-Like Conditions to Survive, Scientists Argue
items.description: One of the main questions surrounding humanity\u2019s next giant leap into deep space is whether humans can thrive on missions far from Earth. A new theory  says yes, but only in environments modeled deeply after our own planet.Read more...

Experts speaking with Gizmodo said the new guidelines mark the\u2026Read more...

Clarke Award in 2016 for his sci-fi tale Children of Time, but he\u2019s equally as well known for his Shadows of the Apt fantasy series. items.description: Just what the hell is happening with the iPhone 15\u2019s external buttons? Despite numerous leaks and countless reports that premium iPhone 15s would ditch physical buttons and get new, trackpad-like touch-based controls, the Cupertino company may have made a last-minute change that has thrown all of that out the window,\u2026Read more...

items.title: Arthur C. Clarke's Classic Childhood's End Gets a Stunning Folio Society Release
items.description: Set in the 1970s, Arthur C. Clarke\u2019s 1953 sci-fi novel Childhood\u2019s End explores an alien invasion that arrives just as the Cold War superpowers are about to venture into space. The \u201cOverlords\u201d create utopia on Earth\u2014and all seems well, until it very much doesn\u2019t. The Folio Society\u2019s new edition of Clarke\u2019s classic\u2026Read more...

items.title: The Best TVs to Buy In 2023
items.description: Let\u2019s be honest: TVs have gotten so good that even the small and cheap ones look pretty great. But the decision of what TV to buy is more complicated than ever. There\u2019s OLED screens and QLED and LED, smart TVs and not so smart, 8K and 4K, and a laundry list of inscrutable features like HDR and VRR. Where to start?Read more...

items.title: Drunk Mice Avoided Hangovers Thanks to a Probiotic
items.description: The hangover cure of the future just might be a chuggable probiotic. In research out this week, scientists in China detail the creation of bacteria that can produce an enzyme meant to help the body break down alcohol faster. Alcohol-fed mice that were given the probiotic beforehand experienced less drunkenness and\u2026Read more...

items.title: The Continental Checks in With a Trailer and Goofy Title

items.title: Rich People’s Swimming Pools Are Making Water Scarce
items.description: As the world gets warmer and droughts grip cities from Madrid to Shanghai, it can seem like we\u2019re headed for a Mad Max-style future where water is a scarce resource. items.title: NPR Ditches Twitter After Elon Labeled Its Account 'State-Affiliated'
items.description: National Public Radio will stop posting on Twitter, across all of its organizational accounts, the media outlet announced on Wednesday. NPR won\u2019t be deleting its accounts off of the Elon Musk-owned platform, however the non-profit news org will cease activity on Twitter. Read more...

items.title: Action First, Doom Later: What Octopuses Can Teach Us About Climate Resilience
items.description: Do you remember the 2016 viral photo of an octopus swimming next to parked cars in a flooded Miami parking garage? A particularly high tide had likely pushed the unsuspecting creature through a drain pipe and into alien territory. For Rob Verchick, climate law scholar, it was a clear sign of climate change\u2014and a\u2026Read more...
